Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. \nHarihar Deo enthralls the audience at.description: Last Saturday, partyhoppers of Bhubaneswar witnessed a very different kind of dance event. A group of some differently-abled dancers performed at a city nightclub and left the partygoers suitably impressed.  Harihar Deo and his troupe provided the evening’s entertainment by performing on Teri meri, Munni badnaam hui, Dhinka chika and lots more. Their performances were followed by a hip-hop show by the group UDT (United Dancing Twisterz) Crew. The guy doing handstands was cheered for most. Later DJ Ravi took the stage. His pulsating music brought everybody to the dance floor. DJ Partho performed after him. Lipsa, a pretty lass from the crowd told BT, “I was here to celebrate my birthday. After watching these amazing people perform and later dancing on such good music made my day special.”Swayamsiddha MohapatraDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nArtistes of Odisha Mining Corporation.description: In an attempt to prove that love is stronger than any other forces in the world, artistes of Odisha Mining Corporation staged the play, “Emiti Bi Hue”, at the Rabindra Mandap on Thursday.  The occasion was the 57th foundation day celebration of OMC. The play was based a the story of Ranjan and Rakesh and the girl they both love. The lead actors impressed the audience with their mature acting and controlled display of emotions. The other actors playing Rakesh’s uncle and a sex workers, played pivotal roles. They too lived up to the expectations. Pradipta Panda, who was following the drama with rapt attention, said, “This was an excellent drama and I enjoyed it very much. The actors also had the ability to capture our attention. For me, it was an evening well-spent.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nPercussionist Jonqui and DJ Whosane!\u.description: It was a dazzling evening that many in Bhubaneswar hadn’t witnessed before. Brightly lit runway, leggy models, fashionable designer clothes, presence of a Bollywood celebrity and a happening after-party — it was a heady concoction for the who’s who of the city. During the fashion show organized at a city five star, the crowd cheered on while the models showcased the two designer’s creations. What more, percussionist Jonqui and DJ Whosane!’s fusion performance added an extra dimension to the show. “It’s my second visit to Bhubaneswar and I must confess that this city has changed a lot from my first visit. People here have started to have a nightlife. I’m glad that I could perform in front of this crowd. They were extremely appreciative,” said the curly haired percussionist Jonqui. DJ Whosane! also had a similar experience. “The crowd cheered loudly after I finished performing. Though I’ve been performing for a long time, this response from the Bhubaneswar crowd was a pleasant surprize for me,” said Whosane! Once the show got over, the party shifted to the crystal room of the hotel. Needless to say, the party animals were in high spirits. BT caught up with Sanu Sharma and his pretty wife Madhu and after posing for the shutterbugs, Sanu said, “We’re really enjoying ourselves and I wish this party never ends.” Young marketing executive Archana Sahu rejoiced the fact that this city is waking up for a nightlife. “We hardly get to attend parties in Bhubaneswar. So when we do, we make the most of it. I’m happy that we got a decent gathering here,” said Archana. What was pleasantly surprising was that former captain of Odisha Ranji cricket team Pravanjan Mallick, who had hit the headlines for slapping wife Cini, was seen enjoying with her at the party. Ollywood actor Sunita was also there in the attendance.Jyoti Prakash Naik & Madhusree GhoshDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yoga Day.description: The world marks the fifth edition of International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2019. Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the main event in Ranchi and performed yoga along with 18,000 people. It was on September 27, 2014 that PM Modi proposed a dedicated day for Yoga to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA). In 2015, the first International Day of Yoga was observed. Here's a look at different yoga styles and its growing popularity worldwide. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Khurda: Flyovers closed to helmetless bi.description: BHUBANESWAR: The Khurda administration on Tuesday prohibited helmet-less bike riders from accessing flyovers in the city in the wake of frequent accidents. A notification issued by the Khurda collector, Bhupendra Singh Poonia, on Monday said a number of fatal accidents had occurred on the flyovers between Khandagiri and Rasulgarh in the recent past and it was imperative to prevent helmetless bikers from getting on these structures. There are six flyovers between Khandagiri and Rasulgarh on the NH-16. Seven people were killed and 20 injured in separate accidents on the flyovers on this stretch over the past two months. The district administration said helmetless bikers were more vulnerable to accidents on flyovers because of thin traffic and more scope for speeding. "We have started asking helmetless bikers to not use flyovers. They will be slapped with fines and diverted to the traffic-heavy service roads otherwise," regional transport officer (zone-2) Sanjay Kumar Behera said. Some road-safety experts, however, questioned the rationale behind prohibiting helmetless bike riders from using flyovers only. "Use of helmet is compulsory on any public road, be it a flyover or a highway. It seems that the administration wants the people to use helmets only on flyovers," said Prateek Ray, a road-safety engineer, said. Commissioner Satyajit Mohanty said police had been conducting crackdowns on those riding bikes without helmets on all roads. "We do not discriminate between flyovers and other roads. Our drive against helmetless bikers is on across the city. We have been taking steps to minimize road accidents. Black spots have been identified on the flyovers and NHAI officials have been asked to take steps to bring down the speed of the vehicles at the accident-prone spots," he said. The capital has seen a rise in road deaths in 2018 as compared to 2017. While 185 people died in accidents in Bhubaneswar in 2017, the figure shot up to 226 last year. The majority of the deaths was reported on the NH-16. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rahul Gandhi.description: NEW DELHI: Strongly indicating that he does not intend to review his decision to step down as Congress president after the party's Lok Sabha debacle, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said the party would decide on his successor and he would keep himself aloof from the process. Asked by the media in the Parliament complex about his possible successor, Rahul crucially did not parry the question but answered that he was not the person to decide on the issue and that it was a task for the party. After weeks of anonymous claims, this was the first confirmation of his intent to quit as the AICC chief ever since he announced the decision at a closed-door meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) on May 25. While the apex body turned down the resignation, Congress insiders said that Rahul is insistent on leaving the top job and had rebuffed all attempts to persuade him to stay on. Lok Sabha poll fallout: Congress considers naming interim presidentEven before Rahul publicly declared his intent, there were indications that Congress was considering naming a working president or interim president at the head of a "collegium" of leaders. Names of veterans like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sushilkumar Shinde, Ashok Gehlot, Mukul Wasnik and Prithviraj Chavan have done the rounds as likely candidates. Rahul's insistence that no one from the Gandhi family should hold the post effectively rules out sister Priyanka. Take charge, douse fire in Cong: Moily tells Rahul GandhiRahul's brief remark comes at a time when the party is caught in a bitter blame-game with its data department under Praveen Chakraborty in the crossfire for "misleading" the leadership on the trends in the Lok Sabha elections. The attack has been sharp with allegations that the data itself was not reliable with Chakraborty's proximity to Rahul raising the question whether the "feedback" only served to strengthen the leader's inclination to target PM Narendra Modi's image. Meanwhile, Rahul met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel along with AICC state in-charge P L Punia for a political discussion on Thursday evening. Party leaders attach importance to the meeting given that he has been reluctant to interact with colleagues lately. However, Rahul's public attestation about quitting may make it difficult for AICC managers to sway his thinking. As it became apparent that he might actually refuse to relent, various proposals have been mooted to make decision-making a collective affair through a "collegium" so that Rahul returns to active presidency. There have also been suggestions that a working president could be appointed. The proposal for a collegium is rooted in Rahul's complaint that he has been working alone and the party leaders did not pull their weight behind him in the LS polls. He had aired his grievances at the now-famous CWC brainstorming called after the party failed to improve its performance, going from 44 to 52. However, Congress leaders said they would continue to make efforts to persuade Rahul. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot told TOI, "Rahul has to remain the Congress president. He worked hard and fearlessly. Victory and defeat are part of polls." Gehlot warned if Rahul quits, Congress workers would either become inactive or leave the party.Sources say Rahul is hell-bent on quitting and has made it clear that none from the Gandhi family should be put at the helm of the Congress organisation. In Video:Won't decide who will be the next president of Congress: Rahul GandhiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Naveen Patnaik to attend PM meet on simu.description: BHUBANESWAR: Extending support to the concept of 'one nation, one election', BJD president and chief minister Naveen Patnaik has agreed to be part of an all-party meeting on the subject convened by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi on Wednesday. The chief minister has always expressed support for simultaneous general and assembly polls. The state has been having simultaneous elections since 2004. "Frequent elections affect development. Simultaneous polls will not only reduce the time governments spend under the model code of conduct, it will help them save resources. The BJD chief will express his stance on the subject in Wednesday's meeting," a senior party functionary said, seeking anonymity. Naveen's visit to Delhi will be his second and his meeting with Modi will be his third in less than two weeks. On June 11, the chief minister met Modi for the first time after the election. He was in the national capital to attend a governing council meeting of the NITI Aayog on June 15. The BJD had backed simultaneous polls earlier too when the Law Commission had met representatives of all political parties in July 2018. In 2004, Naveen had razed a year off his assembly term to opt for simultaneous elections. The trend continued in 2009, 2014 and this year. Simultaneous elections have helped the party manage polls effectively, resulting in its winning maximum seats both in the assembly and the Lok Sabha. The BJD has 12 MPs in the Lok Sabha and has decided to play the role of a constructive opposition in Parliament. The newly elected Lok Sabha MPs, who met at the BJD chamber inside the Parliament complex, have decided to extend issue-based support to the Centre. Naveen talks women\u2019s empowerment, s.description: BHUBANESWAR: Chief minister Naveen Patnaik on Saturday urged the Niti Aayog Governing Council to strive towards empowering women while also advocating simultaneous elections in the country, a point raised by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the past. “We must move towards empowering women in all spheres,” a government statement quoted Naveen as saying at the Niti Aayog meeting, which was chaired by Modi. It must be mentioned that the BJD president has been advocating women’s empowerment at various forums and had also taken up the issue of women’s reservation in Parliament and state assemblies during Modi’s first term as Prime Minister. True to his word, Naveen’s party fielded seven women candidates, or one-third of the 21 Lok Sabha seats that went to polls in Odisha. Out of the seven, five women managed to win. Reviving the ‘one nation, one election’ idea mooted by Modi in the past, Naveen said, “As frequent elections affect development climate, it is better to have simultaneous elections in the country.” In 2004, Naveen had advanced the Odisha assembly election to sync it with the Lok Sabha election, despite the fact that his tenure as chief minister was to end a year later. Since then Odisha has been witnessing assembly and Lok Sabha elections together. Reiterating his demand for special category status for Odisha — which he had raised during his meeting with Modi on Tuesday — Naveen proposed to include natural calamity as a criteria for granting such a status. “As an interim measure, states hit by major natural calamities may be declared as ‘Special Focus States’ and granted benefits of Special Category Status for a specific period,” the statement added. Stating that primary sector, especially agriculture, has to be taken care of, the chief minister said, “Judicious utilisation of water resources holds the key.” Naveen also advised the governing council to bring all irrigation projects which are lying incomplete as on April 1, 2019 under the Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana (PMKSY). He also suggested that the PM-KISAN scheme, the Centre’s cash assistance for farmers, should include landless agriculture households and share-croppers, just like the Odisha government has done with its Kalia (Krushak Assistance for Livelihood and Income Augmentation) initiative that has received widespread praise. 27-yr-old jawan from Odisha, hit by IED.description: Angul: Naik Ajit Kumar Sahoo, a jawan from the state’s Dhenkanal district, who was injured in an IED blast in Jammu & Kashmir’s Pulwama on Monday, succumbed to his injuries on Tuesday. The 27-year-old belonged to the 14 Rashtriya Rifles (RR). A pall of gloom descended over Sahoo’s village of Badasuanlo in Kamakhyanagar block after news of his death reached here. His mortal remains were scheduled to reach the village late on Tuesday evening. Nine soldiers, including Sahoo, and two civilians were injured in Pulwama’s Arihal when a group of terrorists targeted a routine Army patrol of 44 RR, with which he was associated at that time, with an IED. Another jawan, havildar Amarjeet Kumar, also succumbed to his injuries. Santosh Kumar Sahoo, father of the martyr, said, “An Army officer from Kolkata called and said my son had been hospitalised. He breathed his last at 2.50 in the morning, the officer said.” Sahoo’s father added, “My son had trained in Bengaluru for one-and-a-half years and then stayed in Kolkata for three years.” The jawan had visited home in the last week of May and left for Jammu & Kashmir on June 2. “Little did I know that it would be his last visit home. It is a great loss for all of us but I am proud that my son sacrificed his life for the country,” said the grieving father. Sahoo was born on June 4, 1992, and had joined the Army on March 20, 2015. On June 1, he was transferred to 14 RR in Jammu & Kashmir from Kolkata. He had earlier worked in the Army Service Corps in Bengaluru. Ashok Sahoo, a close friend of the deceased, told TOI, “Every villager in Badasuanlo is mourning his death. We are in shock.” “He was brave, nice and gentle. Everybody liked him. His death is a great loss for us. His soul will rest in peace when the government takes action against terrorists,” he added. The sub-collector of Kamakhyanagar, Bishnu Prasad Acharya, said Sahoo would receive a full guard of honour. Sahoo’s elder brother, Alok, (30), works in a private company in Bengaluru and his younger sister, Subhalaxmi (21), is married. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nSrinibas Satapathy and M Simadri perfo.description: It was a very different experience for the music lovers of the city as they witnessed the melodious jugalbandi of flute and saxophone, played by Srinibas Satapathy and M Simadri respectively. The occasion was the 33rd Barsha Festival. “It was my first-ever performance at Rabindra Mandap and I am deeply honoured to perform here. I hope the audience loved to listen to Srinibas and me,” said M.Simadri. With the rains doing pitter-patter throughout the evening, the musicians celebrated monsoon in their own special way. “I have never had the opportunity to listen to a flute and a saxophone playing together and the experience was just fabulous. It felt like the duo had invited the rains with their music,” said Jitendra Parida from the audience. During the second half of the evening, students of Utkal University of Culture performed Odissi. The dancers would be happy to know that their performances impressed some Turkish students including Emine, Zehra, Nursan and Esra. In fact, this group of students have now decided to watch Odissi performances on a regular basis. “My friends and I were here just to get a glimpse of the local events. We must say that the performances have delighted us. Now, we are planning to come to this auditorium frequently to enjoy all these local cultural events,” shared Emine. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Government wants NSG on standby for Rath.description: BHUBANESWAR: Odisha police on Wednesday requested the national security guard (NSG) to keep the commandos in readiness at their Hyderabad hub to meet any exigency during the Rath Yatra scheduled for July 4. Rath Yatra that draws a huge crowd is always on the terror radar, police sources said. "We have not received any intelligence input of threat to the festival from any subversive group. As a precautionary measure, we have requested NSG to remain alert in Hyderabad. Last year also we had roped in the NSG during festival," DGP R P Sharma said here after a meeting with representatives of central security forces for smooth conduct of the car festival. Two companies of Rapid Action Force (RAF), officials of Coast Guard and National Disaster Response Force will be deployed during Rath Yatra in Puri. At the meeting, senior officers of Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) assured all cooperation to prevent any evil design of extremist groups or mischief mongers. The Navy and state police will provide timely support to the Coast Guard in the above mission, Sharma said. The DGP also sought better coordination between the state and central forces during the festival. An integrated control room will be set up at Puri Town police station where representatives from Odisha police, CRPF, NDRF, Navy, Coast Guard, RPF and other agencies will remain present round the clock for proper co-ordination. In the meeting, the officers discussed on issues relating to inland security, coastal security, manpower requirement, force requirement and other logistics for smooth conduct of the festival. There was also elaborate discussion on traffic management during the festival. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Counseling balm for kids in trauma in Fa.description: BHUBANESWAR: Ten-year-old Visakha Rao can still hear the wind howl in her sleep. When she does, she clutches a pillow for comfort. While a few months ago, her face would light up at the sight of the Puri beach, now even the mention of it sends a shiver down her spine. Like Visakha, thousands of children in Odisha are suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) more than a month after cyclonic storm Fani hit the state on May 3. In Puri, where the cyclone made landfall and damage was the greatest, more than 10,000 children below 17 years of age are undergoing psychosocial counseling after they started showing symptoms ranging from anxiety and stress to insomnia. Experts have warned that it might take a long time for an entire generation to overcome the mental trauma they have suffered in the aftermath of Fani which claimed 64 lives. At least 300 counselors from six non-profit organisations - aided by the government - have set up temporary centres in Puri alone to provide mental health intervention to affected children. While much of the infrastructure damaged by Fani is being rebuilt and those displaced have returned home, memories of the raging storm still haunt them. "We were without food, power and water for several days. I never want to live through that again," Soumendra, a 12-year-old boy, who has been undergoing counseling, told TOI. Having come face-to-face with the monstrosity of the sea, he is scared to venture out alone. "I feel safe here. The sound of the waves crashing onto the shore disturbs me," he said. It is this fear that gives Soumendra sleepless nights, a common symptom of PTSD. "Children with PTSD fear that they would have to go through the same experience. If the anxiety persists for a prolonged period, they may slip into acute depression," Suvendu Mishra, general secretary of Indian Psychiatric Society (Odisha state branch), said. Mishra added that around 35% to 40% of the children in affected areas showed such symptoms and it may take anything between three and six months to fully recover. By-election to 3 Rajya Sabha seats in Od.description: BHUBANESWAR: By-election to three Rajya Sabha seats in Odisha vacated by Achyuta Samanta, Soumya Ranjan Patnaik and Pratap Keshari Deb will be held on July 5. Patnaik and Deb resigned from the upper house after they got elected to the 16th Odisha assembly while Samanta vacated the seat after he became a Lok Sabha member from Kandhamal. Tenure of Patnaik and Samanta is due till April 2024 while that of Deb is till July 2022. Though Anubhav Mohanty has also resigned from the Rajya Sabha after he elected to the Lok Sabha from Kendrapada, there will be no by-election for his seat as less than a year left for completion of his tenure. Mohanty’s Rajya Sabha tenure will end in April 2020. According to a notification issued by the Election Commission of India, notification for the by-election will be issued on June 18 while last date of filing nomination is June 25. Election will be held during 9 am to 4 pm on July 5. Going by the number of MLAs in the state assembly, the BJD would comfortably retain all three Rajya Sabha seats. Many senior BJD leaders, who were deprived of party tickets during the recent polls, are eyeing Rajya Sabha berths. Some of the heavyweight leaders in the ruling party, who lost the recent elections, also lobbying hard in the Rajya Sabha race. BJD insiders said party president Naveen Patnaik would take a call on the issue very soon. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bhubaneswar municipal body to educate tr.description: BHUBANESWAR: The Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to launch training and awareness camps to educate traders on the polythene ban. The move comes after the BMC's squads implementing the no-plastic rule faced protests from traders while conducting raids on shops. The awareness drive will be conducted in the BMC office in phases. Its objective will be to ensure that traders don't argue with members of the enforcement squads during raids on shops. "The traders are still not aware of why the raids are being conducted and which type of polythene can be used and which can't. They (traders) think we are seizing all varieties of polythene bags from them, which is not the case," said BMC deputy commissioner Prabir Khillar. According to the guideline of the Central Pollution Control Board, the manufacture, sale and use of polythene bags of thickness below 50 micron is not allowed. Khillar said very few traders understood the guideline and almost none stocked carry-bags of thickness of 50 micron or more. "The awareness camp will make our work easy and the traders won't have to pay penalty," he added. The BMC has so far seized 3.5 quintal of the banned polythene and collected Rs 40,000 in fine. The BMC's commissioner Samarth Verma has directed the zonal deputy commissioners of the three zones to conduct raids on fish, meat and fruit markets every Wednesday. Vendors at these markets mostly use very thin carry-bags to sell their items. Thin polythene is hazardous to the environment. The BMC has also started a process to identify polythene bag manufacturers by getting information from wholesalers and traders. At present, the BMC doesn't have comprehensive data on polythene-makers. On October 2, 2018, the state imposed a ban on the sale, use and manufacture of plastic bags with less than 50 micron thickness in Bhubaneswar, Cuttack, Puri, Rourkela, Sambalpur and Berhampur. Raids were conducted on shops for some days but then they petered out. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Robbers loot Rs 35L from bank staff in B.description: BHUBANESWAR: Unidentified miscreants allegedly robbed Rs 35 lakh cash from two employees of a bank near Nakhara under Balianta police stations limits near here on Friday. The bank employees were transporting the cash in a taxi when the loot took place. "We were transporting the cash from our Niali branch to the bank's currency chest in Saheed Nagar. Nearly 10 minutes after leaving the Niali branch, an SUV overtook us and stopped. Five or six masked persons came out, assaulted us and fled with the money bag," Kanhu Charan Behera, one of the bank employees, told journalists. Police said the incident occurred around 3 pm. Deputy commissioner of police Anup Kumar Sahoo said, "We are questioning the two bank employees and the taxi driver. Their charges are being verified," Sahoo said. Police suspect the role of insiders (bank authorities) in the robbery. "Someone from the bank must have leaked information about the cash being transported. The bank should have adopted adequate safety precautions before transporting huge cash," a police official said. tnn Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

No headway in proposed second campus of.description: BHUBANESWAR: The issue of finalising a suitable land for second campus of the Rama Devi Women’s University had created hue and cry last year. Coming under pressure, the state government had selected a land at Gothapatna in Khurda district for the purpose. But nothing has been done so far except selection of the location. The state government had created Rama Devi Women's University at Bhubaneswar, Gangadhar Meher University at Sambalpur and Khallikote Cluster University at Berhampur on May 30, 2015. “The last two universities have already received land much earlier, but the government is yet to give any official communication to the state’s first women university about finalisation of the land,” said a senior teacher of the university. The government had selected two lands on outskirts of the city, but the university had opposed the selection due to its remote location. On January 30 last year, the higher education department had issued a notification to identify a 30-acre land inside Utkal University for the second campus of the RD University. But students had opposed the government notification and vehemently protested it. Later, the government had dropped the idea to take Utkal land and formed an extended committee on February 19 last year to identify land for the RD University. The committee had submitted its report on March 15 last year regarding the land for the second campus. It has proposed for a land at Gothapatna, but no progress on the issue after that. “The land at Gothapatna has 78 acres, but there is no clarity about how many acres have been allotted for the university. It will take another round of discussion before handing it over to the institution,” said a senior higher education department official. Padmaja Mishra, vice chancellor of the university, said she did not get any official communication regarding the allotment of the land for the second campus. “After getting land, we will make plan for construction,” she added. The present campus is spread over 22 acres of land near Rupali Square. As it is an affiliating university and 48 women's colleges under its jurisdiction, it gets immense load of the colleges along with PG and M Phil programmes. “We have not started our PhD programmes due to lack of infrastructure. We don’t have land to set up good laboratories and research centres to start doctoral programmes. Space is needed for starting new departments like Business Administration and Journalism,” said a senior teacher. The university cannot host inter-college or inter-university sports meet due to lack of a good playground and a sports complex. “Besides, we need staff quarters and guest house inside the campus like other universities,” said the teacher. Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Demand a new stunt by Naveen Patnaik: BJ.description: BHUBANESWAR: Chief minister Naveen Patnaik's demand to recognize states hit by major calamities as 'special focus states' has triggered criticism from the BJP. The saffron outfit termed Naveen's demand as 'a new political stunt' and accused the BJD government of lacking political will to judiciously utilize the resources provided by the Centre. The Congress, despite supporting Naveen's demand, questioned his sincerity. "Keeping the interest of the people of Odisha in mind, the demand is justified, and I support it. But, I want to question Naveen babu as to what happened to his commitment on according special status to Odisha, which he made when he was a Union minister?" senior Congress leader Narasingha Mishra questioned. Senior BJP leader Prithviraj Harichandan said the Narendra Modi government has sanctioned adequate resources for the state which needs to be spent with effective planning. "The state government has failed to utilize the amount due to lack of political will," Harichandan said. Naveen, who met Prime Minister Modi in New Delhi on Tuesday, demanded that states hit by major calamities may be declared as 'special focus states' and granted benefits of special category status for a specific period. The chief minister proposed that his demand be accepted until the Centre includes natural calamity as an indicator for according special category status to a state. State's planning and convergence minister Padmanabha Behera said Odisha faces huge loss due to frequent natural calamities which also impacts the growth of the state. "What the chief minister has said will help all states facing calamities," Behera said Well known development activist Jagadananda welcomed the demand to include natural calamity as an indicator to accord special tag to a state but said Odisha must prepare a disaster-resilient development framework to properly utilize the resources. Sources in the chief minister's office said Naveen would also raise the issue at the NITI Aayog governing council meeting scheduled in New Delhi on Saturday. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Environment Day celebrated with fervor i.description: Bhubaneswar residents and various organisations celebrated World Environment Day recently by holding various programmes and conducting activities like planting trees and distributing saplings and cleaning the surroundings. The East Coast Railway also observed the day on its campus. Around 375 East Coast Railway employees and volunteers of Bharat Scout and Guides participated in an awareness drive to sensitise people about environmental issues, especially the Swachh Bharat Abhiyan, to mark the day. These youngsters also did a prabhat pheri and organised a painting competition to create awareness about a pollution-free environment, where a large number of children took part. The officials also urged the employees to contribute in their own ways to reduce pollution and work for betterment of the environment. Senior officials, including the ECoR additional general manager Sudhir Kumar, conducted a plantation drive. They planted saplings inside the railway campus, which had lost several trees in the recent cyclone. The ECoR also has been trying to keep the stations and railway premises clean and hygienic by putting more bio-toilets, provision for plastic bottle crushing machines and regular cleanliness drives on trains and station premises. The Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation (BMC) also observed the day by conducting cleanliness and plantation drives. They also conducted raids at various shops to check use of plastic bags, which have been banned in the city since last year. BMC had been take strict action against shops selling stuff in plastic bags, but the work had slowed down after the cyclone. On World Environment Day, they conducted the drive again by forming squads. Several NGOs and private and government institutions also observed the day by either planting trees or distributing saplings among participants. Actress Anu Choudhury, who was part of one such drive, told us, “It’s our duty to protect our environment and that can be possible by planting more trees.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Statue ofMahatmavandalised.description: Balasore: A statue of Mahatma Gandhi was found vandalised in Sovarampur government nodal upper primary school in Balasore district. It came to light when locals entered the school premises on Sunday after they noticed that some trees had been felled inside the compound. President, school managing committee, Surendra Singh, said, “Five anti-socials entered the school on June 14 evening. They vandalised the statue installed in 2006 besides ransacking the school and its garden,” he said. “A room christened ‘Bapuji Kakhya’ in the school in honour of the ‘Father of the Nation’ was also ransacked. Cigarette butts and empty liquor bottles were strewn on the floor,” he added. Sailabala Rout, headmistress of the school said after school hours, the anti-socials enter the premises with liquor and drugs. IIC of Sahadevkhunta police station S S Nayak said the incident is suspected to have taken place on June 14 and could be the handiwork of anti-socials as the school was shut for the summer vacation. All-party meet ahead of Odisha assembly.description: BHUBANESWAR: Speaker Surya Narayan Patro plans to hold an all-party meeting either on June 23 or 24 before the start of the budget session of the assembly to seek cooperation for the smooth running of the house. Though such practices are very common before the start of Lok Sabha sessions, Odisha assembly has not witnessed any such move by a speaker in recent history. In Odisha, all party meetings were convened only when there are logjams. “It is the speaker’s duty to listen to members of all political parties to understand their issues. An all-party meeting will be held before start of the session to seek cooperation from all for smooth- running of the house. Important issues will be discussed,” Patro told reporters here. Congress veteran Narasingha Mishra and senior BJP leader Jayanarayan Mishra welcomed the speaker’s decision. The legislature meetings of all the three major parties, BJD, BJP and Congress, will also be held on June 24. The first session of the 16th assembly will start from June 25 with the address of Governor Ganeshi Lal. Finance minister Niranjan Pujari will present the annual budget for 2019-20 fiscal on June 28. The session will have 30 working days in two phases. With at least 63 MLAs elected to the assembly for the first-time, the assembly secretariat will hold one-day training programme for the new MLAs to help them understand various procedures of house functioning. Later in Sepetember, a three-day training programme will be conducted for the new legislators, said Patro. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Heatwave to continue for two more days:.description: Bhubaneswar: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecast on Tuesday said the heatwave may continue in parts of the state for the next two days in tune with the current trend. In Sambalpur, mercury touched 45°C, the day’s highest in the state and 7°C above normal. Day temperature at 12 other places, mostly in the interior pockets, was hovering between 40°C and 44°C . The state capital recorded 40.3°C, which is 4°C above normal. Director of IMD, Bhubaneswar, H R Biswas said there would be no respite till Thursday. Wednesday’s forecast said heatwave is likely to prevail at some places over 10 of the 30 districts. These are Jharsuguda, Sambalpur, Sundargarh, Deogarh, Angul, Bargarh, Sonepur, Balangir, Nuapada and Kalahandi. Dry weather, clear sky and absence of thunderstorm activities would influence the rise in mercury level, Biswas said. He said there might be thunderstorms again after two days. He said such trend usually prevails during the pre-monsoon period. He said interior pockets will see major rise compared to coastal pockets. The weatherman further forecast that cyclone Vayu over the Arabian Sea delayed the monsoon and it may again get delayed further after the cyclone passes. The office of the Special Relief Commissioner (SRC) in the wake of fresh heatwave warning, asked people to take precautions before going out in the sun. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. \nRock band competition organized in Bhu.description: It was time for some rock ’n’ roll for Bhubaneswar music lovers as a city club organized a rock band competition. Bands both from and outside Odisha participated in the event. A huge crowd gathered at the club and cheered on loudly when the bands — Despite Premonition and 666 from Bhubaneswar and Mind Eras(H)er from Kolkata — competed against each other. Ultimately, Mind Eras(H)er’s energetic performance on tracks like, “My girl with someone else” and “Tera emotional atyachar”, helped them bag the winner’s title. “We are really very happy to win this competition as the other bands were equally good. We have been performing throughout the country and this is our seventh trip to Odisha. It’s very satisfactory to perform in Bhubaneswar as the crowd response is very encouraging for a new band like us,” said Prince, the lead vocalist of Mind Eras(H)er. An interesting fact about them is, they are a seven-month-old band and they have won 19 competitions in five months, four of which were held in Odisha. While Odisha is close to their heart, are they open to composing for Ollywood? To this Prince said, “Though we haven’t yet got any offers, we are game.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Heritage walks start after a break in ci.description: The weekly Heritage Walks are going to restart again from this weekend after a break of over a month owing to cyclone Fani. Several such walks are conducted in Bhubaneswar. In these, local people and tourists are taken on curated tours of Old Town and Khandagiri Udayagiri hills along with the Odisha Craft Museum. Moreover, the Heritage Walk to Khandagiri — Monks, Kings and Caves — is going to restart again every Saturday morning. The paticipants can go and watch the caves, which are around 2000 years ago while a guide will narrate details about the caves and the structures and the history and legends surrounding the places and structures. The Old Town circuit, which used to be held every Sunday morning, are also restarting. Participants of these walks start their trail from Mukteswar Temple after a morning flute recital and go through various temples and historical structures before entering the Ekamra vana on the bank of the sacred Bindusagar pond. Then they are treated to an Odissi dance performance by students of Padma Shri Guru Ileana Citaristi. This walk had been going on for over two years. On Sunday afternoons, the Museum Walk inside the Odisha Craft Museum, also known as Kalabhoomi, is conducted. The participants get to know about various arts and crafts of Odisha along with the history and take part in the craft workshops. “Bhubaneswar faced the wrath of nature during cyclone Fani last month and for that, we had to temporarily halt the walks. Besides, there was a heatwave kind of situation here. Since things have more or less returned to normal, we decided to restart the walks. And Raja Parba is the best occasion to do it,” said Sophia Simon, a member of the organising team. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Odisha govt prods colleges, varsities on.description: BHUBANESWAR: The state government has asked the director of higher education and the registrars of seven state universities to submit by June 20 a detailed calculation of additional liabilities from January 1, 2016, to March 31 this year after revision of salary according to the UGC pay scale. The universities that have been asked to submit the details are Utkal University, Berhampur University, Sambalpur University, Ravenshaw University, Fakir Mohan University, North Odisha University and Shree Jagannath Sanskrit University. Last year, the government had decided to revise the salary of state-run university and college teachers on the basis of the Seventh Pay Commission recommendations starting from January 1, 2016. The higher education department had asked the universities to submit the calculation of arrears in March this year but the latter could not do so. "This letter is a reminder to the university authorities. They could not submit the details on time because of Cyclone Fani. We hope they will submit them this time and the government can pay the arrears of the teachers," said a senior official of the higher education department. The teachers have been requesting the government to pay them their pending arrears and revised salary. According to the revision decision, the teachers will get a hike between 2.57 and 2.72 times of their basic pay and average grade pay. The Centre will reimburse 50 per cent of the arrears for the three years, while the rest will be paid by the state. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bhubaneswar: Hospitals, clinics lack bas.description: BHUBANESWAR: The Odisha Fire Services (OFS) on Tuesday found that most private hospitals and clinics in the city lacked fire-safety systems. A surprise inspection of 15 leading hospitals showed that only five had procured fire-safety certificates. The fire services personnel found that the hospitals did not have basic fire-safety equipment such as extinguishers. The inspection of hospitals comes on the heels of a recent crackdown on coaching centres across the state for flouting fire-safety norms. "Many hospitals have converted their basements into godowns of unserviceable utility materials, posing a high risk to the lives of patients and staff," director-general of police (DGP, fire services and home guard) B K Sharma said . Some hospitals had electrical panel boards below the staircases and the corridors were blocked by dumping of unused articles. Sharma added, "We will issue circulars to the erring hospitals asking them to adopt foolproof fire-safety mechanism and obtain no-objection certificates (NOCs) from us. Though they had applied for NOCs, we rejected their applications as the hospitals failed to meet even the basic fire-safety requirements." The DGP further said it was not possible to seal the hospital buildings as they rendered emergency services. "We will constantly monitor them until they have the required arrangements in place," he added. A fire services personnel said the inspection was aimed to make hospitals comply with fire-safety norms for the safety of patients, visitors, doctors, staff and train the staff in fire-fighting. The fire services officials taught evacuation exercises to the doctors and the staff and sensitised them on how to use the fire-safety devices. "Hospitals need sufficient time to install the requisite fire-fighting mechanisms because the process demands a structural renovation. We need approval from the Bhubaneswar Development Authority to make structural changes in the buildings. We will abide by the recommendations from the experts," said Prabhat Tripathy, manager of a private hospital. Bhubaneswar has over 200 private hospitals and clinics. The issue of inspection assumes significance in the wake of a fire tragedy at SUM Hospital in October 2016, in which 20 people were killed. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP to name leader of opposition soon.description: Bhubaneswar: The BJP is likely to pick its legislature party leader — who will be the leader of opposition in the assembly— this week, party insiders said. Four MLAs — Jayanarayan Mishra (Sambalpur), Mohan Charan Majhi (Keonjhar), Bishnu Charan Sethi (Dhamnagar) and Pradipta Kumar Naik (Bhawanipatna) — are in the race for the leader of opposition position, a cabinet rank. The 23 BJP MLAs are likely to meet towards the weekend and formally select their leader. Given that the budget session of the assembly starts on June 25, the selection will take place before that, BJP sources said. Mishra is a former commerce and transport minister from 2004-2009 in the BJP-BJD alliance government. The firebrand leader becomes a natural choice for the post being a four-time MLA. “I would not like to make any comment on speculation. There is no if and but in politics. I am ready to carry out any responsibility given to me by the party,” Mishra told TOI. Naik, a Scheduled Caste, is also a top contender for the post since he has also won the assembly election four times from Bhawanipatna. Keonjhar MLA Majhi, a tribal, is a three-time legislator . “It is ultimately for the party to decide whom to make the leader of opposition. As a dedicated BJP worker, I will abide by whatever decision is taken. However, if Im am given the responsibility, I will strive hard to do my work as sincerely as possible,” he said. The other contender, Sethi, is a second time-legislator from Dhamnagar in Bhadrak district. It will be for the first time in Odisha history the BJP will assume the role of principal opposition. It shared power with the Naveen Patnaik-led BJD from 2000 to 2009. The BJP finished as the third largest party in the state after the assembly polls in 2009 and 2014 conceding the space of principal opposition to the Congress. The saffron party did not have much of a presence in the state till the 90s. This time, the Congress with nine MLAs has finished a distant third. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Doctors, medical students protest attack.description: BHUBANESWAR: Doctors and medical students in the state on Friday staged demonstrations and rally at different medical colleges and hospitals protesting attack on medicos at NRS Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata. Medical students, interns, junior residents and senior residents of AIIMS Bhubaneswar staged demonstration in front of the registration counter of the hospital expressing solidarity to their counterparts in West Bengal. They later took out a rally in the institute campus flaunting placards and shouting slogans like ‘we want justice’ and ‘save doctors’. “Physical violence along with government apathy is unacceptable for any individual in this country. The repeated atrocious acts of barbarism have propelled pan India strike and support to our younger brothers and sisters. We condemn the attack on doctors in Kolkata,” said a statement of Residents’ Doctor Association of the institute. Due to the token dharna, OPD services were affected. Consultation of doctors with patients got delayed. But later the junior doctors joined the senior doctors in the hospital service. “It was a token strike, so treatment of patients was not affected. Emergency and indoor patient service were normal,” said Sachidananda Mohanty, medical superintendent of the AIIMS Bhubaneswar. Members of the Indian Medical Association (IMA) state chapter staged a demonstration in front of the office here protesting attack on the doctors. “Expressing solidarity with doctors in West Bengal, IMA has given a strike call on June 17 across the country. We will discuss with our members and take a call on Saturday regarding this,” said Janmejay Mohapatra, honorary state secretary of IMA Odisha. IMA Rourkela chapter also staged demonstration expressing solidarity to the doctors in Kolkata. “Considering the consistent rise in violence against doctors and medical establishments, the IMA has been demanding for implementation of a national law, which should have a provision of at least seven year imprisonment for the hospital violence," said Ranjan Kumar Dutta, president, IMA Rourkela city chapter. Prabhat Rout, president of Junior Doctor Association of SCB Medical College and Hospital, said junior doctors in all medical colleges in the state showed their solidarity by wearing black badge. “We will call a meeting on Sunday and decide our next course of action,” he added. On Thursday, resident doctors and MBBS students at SCB Medical College and Hospital in Cuttack had burnt effigy of West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee protesting attack on their fellow doctors in the neighbouring state. Junior Doctors Associations (JDA) of all state-run medical colleges has strongly condemned the attack. (With inputs from Mihir Ray from Rourkela) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nState Pollution Control Board employes.description: The employees of the State Pollution Control Board recently staged the Odia play, Kuhudi Nai at Rabindra Mandap, Bhubaneswar as a part of their Annual Day celebration. The play showed how a family gets divided into three political wings as the three brothers join three different political parties. Pinky and Tasatosh Mishra played important roles in the play. The play also starred Debadutta Pattnaik, Manisha Rath, Dibakar Nath, Binod Bihari Dash, Chiranjeev Mishra, Batakrushna Panda and Prakash Jena. All the actors gave their best while performing, especially Manisha Rath, who impressed the audience with her portrayal of Bharati.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP out to spoil BJD party in Bijepur by.description: BHUBANESWAR: The fight for the byelection to the Bijepur assembly seat has began in right earnest. Buoyed by the success in the recent elections where the BJP picked up all five Lok Sabha seats in western Odisha, of which Bijepur is a part, the party is hoping to snatch the seat that had elected Naveen Patnaik to the assembly. With Naveen elected from both Bijepur and Hinjili in the assembly election, he had to vacate one. He chose to retain Hinjili, his traditional seat, necessitating a bypoll in Bijepur. And given that the constituency had voted for Naveen, the byelection has turned into a prestige battle for the BJD. Even though official notification for the byelection is yet to be issued, the BJD and the BJP have started their groundwork. BJD insiders said Naveen may meet senior party leaders from western Odisha to discuss strategy for Bijepur after returning from New Delhi on Saturday. “People of Bijepur have blessed the BJD. The chief minister has assured them that he will personally monitor development works in the constituency. People will bless whoever Naveen decides to nominate for the byelection,” senior BJD leader Kishore Mohanty said. Naveen has already announced a package for the constituency with focus on housing, water supply, irrigation, healthcare, connectivity and infrastructure. Interestingly, people in Bijepur will be voting in an assembly election (including bypoll) for the third time in just over a year. In February last year, Rita Sahu won from the constituency for the BJD in a byelection following the death of her husband Subal Sahu, who had won the seat for three successive terms on a Congress ticket. Rita seems to be the frontrunner for the BJD ticket. She has already started people connect exercises in the constituency. Former Bargarh MP Prabhas Kumar Singh and senior leader Subash Chauhan, who left the BJP to join the BJD ahead of the elections, are also among the contenders. The BJP too has a number of aspirants. Sanat Kumar Gartia, who got 28.91 per cent votes against Naveen in the recent assembly election, seems to be the frontrunner. Names of Ashok Panigrahi, the BJP candidate in the 2018 byelection and senior leader Pradip Purohit, who lost from adjacent Padampur seat, are also doing the rounds. Though the party had done well from the region in the Lok Sabha election, the assembly poll didn’t go as planned, with BJP winning eight of the 35 seats in western Odisha with the BJD bagging 22. Asked about the possible BJP candidate, Gartia said, “In the BJP, the central leadership takes a call on candidature and cadres work to ensure his/her victory.” The Congress, which polled just 7.75 per cent vote in the recently held assembly election, too has started an exercise to field a suitable candidate. Naveen-Dharmendra Delhi meeting to discu.description: BHUBANESWAR: Chief minister Naveen Patnaik and Union petroleum and steel minister Dharmendra Pradhan are scheduled to meet at Odisha Bhavan in New Delhi on Friday. The two are likely to discuss enhancing Odisha's footprint in the steel sector besides the progress of the proposed petroleum, chemicals and petrochemicals investment region in Paradip, which envisages an investment of Rs one lakh crore in the next few years. It would be the two leaders first formal business meeting after Narendra Modi government came to power at the Centre for a second time and Naveen Patnaik took oath as Odisha chief minister for a fifth term. The BJD termed the upcoming meeting as a natural process in state's interest. "Odisha being a steel hub, it is natural for the chief minister to meet the Union steel minister to take forward the state's interest," said BJD spokesperson Pratap Keshari Deb. In his last visit to the state on June 8, Dharmendra had said the Centre will help to develop the state as a global hub of ancillary industry in the steel sector. While India is the second largest steel-producing nation after China, Odisha is a hub of steel industry in the country. Odisha has around a dozen steel plants, including PSU Rourkela Steel Plant. During his week-long stay in the national capital starting June 9, Naveen has met Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeking 'special focus state' status to states hit with natural disasters besides paying a courtesy call to President Ram Nath Kovind. Naveen is scheduled to return to Odisha on June 15 after attending the Niti Aayog Governing Council meeting. Naveen-Dharmendra meeting is often seen in political prism, Dharmendra being BJP's Odisha face and the saffron party being Naveen's main challenge in the state. After a bitter poll battle, the two sides, however, have shown increasing bonhomie towards each other. A "chance encounter" between Naveen and Dharmendra at Indira Gandhi International Airport, New Delhi on April 30 - video clips of which showed the two coming out of the airport and shaking hands-- had given fodder for speculation regarding changing relation between the estranged partners, BJP and BJD. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

JEE Advanced: Sambit tops India in SC ca.description: BHUBANESWAR: Sambit Behera from Bhubaneswar became the all-India topper in the scheduled caste (SC) category of the JEE (Advanced) examination 2019, the results of which were published on Friday. He secured an all-India rank (AIR) of 45 in the coveted examination, which allows one to get admission into the IITs of the country. He had secured an AIR of 11 in JEE (Mains) 2019. Sambit, son of a banker, moved to Kota in Rajasthan to continue his Class XII and started taking engineering coaching there. He said, "I am very happy. I want to get into IIT Bombay." He had been preparing for the examination for the last two years. "I am interested in computer programming. I will opt for a BTech in computer science," he said. He would advise JEE aspirants to focus on their subjects on a daily basis and choose good books for preparation. Sayantan Dhar, a Sai International School student, secured an AIR of 51 in the examination. He stood fifth in the Kharagpur zone. He had scored 99.961 percentile in JEE Mains held in January this year. Sayantan, son of a banker, wants to study computer science engineering at IIT Bombay. "I was preparing for the examination at a coaching institute in Bhubaneswar for the last two years. I used to devote around eight hours to prepare for the exam every day," he added. Three other students from the school made it to the top-100 list. They were Sibasis Nayak with an AIR of 58, Pratik Choudhury at AIR 83 and Gyanaranjan Behura AIR (SC/ST) 6. Altogether 4,360 students from Odisha qualified for the JEE (Mains), but only 575 could crack it. IIT Bhubaneswar congratulated the rank holders and invited them to the JEE Open house organised by the institute on June 18. It will facilitate the students with requisite information and help them to make the right career choices and give them a hands-on experience of the IIT system. Apart from all the JEE advanced qualified candidates, even the prospective students preparing for JEE examination in 2020 are welcome to visit IIT Bhubaneswar for a live counselling session for JEE Open House.
